intro: Eutoca aretioides var. perpusilla, commonly known as the dwarf eutoca, is a small, flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
